revised_title: An Inquiry into the Causes of Different Skin Colors in Different Climates
tldr: The author investigates the causes of different skin colors in white and black individuals, proposing that the thickness and density of the skin, along with the transparency of the epidermis, play a significant role in determining skin color. The study also examines the role of blood circulation and the impact of external factors such as fever and jaundice on skin color.
